metadata.title: CVE-2019-9512 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to ping floods, potentiallyleading to a denial of service. The attacker sends continual pings to anHTTP/2 peer, causing the peer to build an internal queue of responses.Depending on how efficiently this data is queued, this can consume excessCPU, memory, or both.

criterions.comment: golang-1.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
golang-1.10: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
trafficserver: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
